'''Satya Narayana Nadella''' ({{Lang-te|నాదెళ్ల సత్యనారాయణ }}, {{IPAc-en|n|ə|ˈ|d|ɛ|l|ə}}; born 19 August 1967) is an [[Indian-American]] business executive. He is the [[executive chairman]] and [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of [[Microsoft]], succeeding [[Steve Ballmer]] in 2014 as CEO<ref name="autogenerated2">{{cite web |last=Ovide |first=Shira |url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304851104579362603637152172 |title=Microsoft Board Names Satya Nadella as CEO |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=5 February 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141019013422/http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304851104579362603637152172 |archive-date=19 October 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web |url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/news/press/2014/feb14/02-04newspr.aspx |title=Microsoft Board names Satya Nadella as CEO |publisher=Microsoft.com |date=4 February 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140426032128/http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/news/press/2014/feb14/02-04newspr.aspx |archive-date=26 April 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> and [[John W. Thompson]] in 2021 as chairman.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.microsoft.com/2021/06/16/microsoft-board-of-directors-announces-role-changes-and-quarterly-dividend/|title=Microsoft board of directors announces role changes and quarterly dividend|work=Microsoft|date=16 June 2021|access-date=16 June 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2021/06/16/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-will-also-become-chairman-of-the-board.html|title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella named chairman of the board|work=CNBC|date=16 June 2021|access-date=16 June 2021}}</ref> Before becoming CEO, he was the executive vice president of Microsoft's cloud and enterprise group, responsible for building and running the company's computing platforms.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Bhanver|first=Jagmohan S.|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=woCFAwAAQBAJ|title=Nadella: The Changing Face of Microsoft|date=2014-11-10|publisher=Hachette India|isbn=978-93-5009-891-2|language=en}}</ref>

== Early life ==
Nadella was born in [[Hyderabad]] in [[Andhra Pradesh]] state, India into a [[Telugu language|Telugu]]-speaking [[Hindus|Hindu]] family.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Bhanver |first=Jagmohan S. |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=-BNnAwAAQBAJ&q=Telugu+family+nadella+nadella&pg=PT7 |title=Nadella: The Changing Face of Microsoft |date=2014-11-10 |publisher=Hachette India |isbn=978-93-5009-891-2 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |last=Suryanarayana |first=Pisupati Sadasiva |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=zwXyCwAAQBAJ&dq=satya+nadella+Telugu&pg=PA34 |title=Smart Diplomacy: Exploring China-india Synergy |date=2016-02-29 |publisher=[[World Scientific]] |isbn=978-1-938134-70-8 |pages=34 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |year=2013 |title='Studious, hardworking boy has achieved his goal,' says Satya Nadella's dad |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-studious-hardworking-boy-has-achieved-his-goal-says-satya-nadella-s-dad-1959411 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140205054049/http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-studious-hardworking-boy-has-achieved-his-goal-says-satya-nadella-s-dad-1959411 |archive-date=5 February 2014 |publisher=[[Daily News and Analysis|DNA India]] |df=dmy-all}}</ref> His mother Prabhavati was a [[Sanskrit]] lecturer<ref>{{cite news|title=Remembering ex-bureaucrat BN Yugandhar|url=https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/remembering-ex-bureaucrat-bn-yugandhar/article29430142.ece#|publisher=The Hindu Business Line|access-date=16 September 2019}}</ref> and his father, Bukkapuram Nadella Yugandhar, was an [[Indian Administrative Service]] officer of the 1962 batch.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=peodAAAAIAAJ&q=bukkapuram+nadella+yugandhar|title=The Civil List of Indian Administrative Service, Volume 10|page=331|publisher=Ministry of Home Affairs, India|year=1965|quote=Yugandhar, Bukkapuram Nadella 1962 Andhra Pradesh}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Satya Nadella's father BN Yugandhar passes away at the age of 82|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/satya-nadela-microsoft-ceo-father-bn-yugandhar-dies-hyderabad-1598978-2019-09-13|publisher=India Today|access-date=14 September 2019}}</ref><ref name="dnaindia">[http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-studious-hardworking-boy-has-achieved-his-goal-says-satya-nadella-s-dad-1959411 ‘Studious, hardworking boy has achieved his goal,’ says Satya Nadella's dad] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140205054049/http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-studious-hardworking-boy-has-achieved-his-goal-says-satya-nadella-s-dad-1959411 |date=5 February 2014 }}. ''Daily News and Analysis''. (5 February 2014). Retrieved 16 February 2014.</ref> Yugandhar hailed from Bukkapuram in [[Anantapur district]] of Andhra Pradesh.<ref name=":0">{{cite news |title=When diversity is seen as discrimination |publisher=Livemint |url=https://www.livemint.com/Leisure/9HDVwSeDKkGw5dw3E916uM/When-diversity-is-seen-as-discrimination.html |access-date=15 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-08-05 |title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella okays innovation centre in native district |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/technology/in-other-news/040821/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-okays-innovation-centre-in-native-district.html |access-date=2023-02-27 |website=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |language=en}}</ref> Yugandhar's father migrated from Nadella village in Guntur district of Andhra Pradesh to Bukkapuram.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Benjamin |first=Ravi P. |date=2021-06-19 |title=Bukkapuram, Sathya Nadella's village, yet to cheer his elevation |url=https://www.thehansindia.com/telangana/bukkapuram-sathya-nadellas-village-yet-to-cheer-his-elevation-691478 |access-date=2023-02-27 |website=[[The Hans India]] |language=en |quote=Yugandhar's father migrated from Nadella village in Guntur to Bukkapuram in Yellanur mandal in the district and Yugandhar did his primary school education in the local panchayat school but whereas Sathya had his schooling in Hyderabad Public School.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Sur |first=Aihik |date=14 September 2019 |title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadela's father, former PMO official Nadella Yugandhar passes away |url=https://www.newindianexpress.com/states/andhra-pradesh/2019/sep/14/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadelas-father-former-pmo-official-nadella-yugandhar-passes-away-2033295.html |access-date=2023-02-27 |website=[[The New Indian Express]] |quote=Yugandhar’s family hails from Nadella village in Guntur district of Andhra Pradesh who migrated to Bukkapuram village in Anantapur district around four decades ago. Since then they have retained both Bukkapuram and Nadella in their surname.}}</ref>

Satya Nadella attended the [[The Hyderabad Public School, Begumpet|Hyderabad Public School, Begumpet]]<ref>{{Cite web|title=How one high school produced the CEOs of Microsoft, Adobe and Mastercard|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/04/05/one-high-school-produced-the-ceos-of-microsoft-adobe-and-mastercard.html|last=Hess|first=Abigail|date=2018-04-05|website=CNBC|language=en|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref> before receiving a bachelor's in [[electrical engineering]] from the [[Manipal Institute of Technology]] in [[Karnataka]] in 1988.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/bangalore/1880581/report-mit-thrilled-over-nadella-being-in-race-to-head-microsoft |title=MIT thrilled over Nadella being in race to head Microsoft |publisher=DNA India |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130829050118/http://www.dnaindia.com/bangalore/1880581/report-mit-thrilled-over-nadella-being-in-race-to-head-microsoft |archive-date=29 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=India's MIT costs less than $6,000 a year—and look where it got Satya Nadella|url=https://qz.com/174431/indias-mit-costs-37000-a-year-less-than-the-uss-and-look-where-it-got-satya-nadella/|last=Timmons|first=Heather|website=Quartz|date=6 February 2014 |language=en|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref> Nadella then traveled to the U.S. to study for an [[Master of science|MS]] in [[computer science]] at the [[University of Wisconsin–Milwaukee]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/story/_/id/20977179/cricket-not-shy-away-technological-change-throwing-new-challenges|title=I went to the United States right when Sachin Tendulkar started to play for India so I look at it and say, wow, I missed the entire Sachin era of Indian cricket|website=Espncricinfo.com|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171011050101/http://www.espncricinfo.com/story/_/id/20977179/cricket-not-shy-away-technological-change-throwing-new-challenges|archive-date=11 October 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> receiving his degree in 1990.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bizjournals.com/milwaukee/news/2014/01/30/new-microsoft-ceo-could-be-uwm-grad.html|title=Next Microsoft CEO could be UWM graduate|website=www.bizjournals.com|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref> Later, he received an [[master of business administration|MBA]] from the [[University of Chicago Booth School of Business]] in 1997.<ref>{{cite web | last=Hollar | first=Sherman | title=Satya Nadella - Biography & Facts | website=Encyclopedia Britannica | date=December 1, 2020 | url=https://www.britannica.com/biography/Satya-Nadella | access-date=September 9, 2021}}</ref><ref name="Time" />

== Career ==
=== Sun Microsystems ===
Nadella worked at [[Sun Microsystems]] as a member of its technology staff before joining Microsoft in 1992.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/the-rise-of-microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-2016-1#but-they-didnt-have-a-real-computer-science-program-so-he-traveled-to-the-us-to-attend-university-of-wisconsin-milwaukee-where-he-graduated-in-1990-1|title=The rise of Satya Nadella, the CEO who totally turned Microsoft around in 5 years and made it more valuable than Apple|date=4 February 2019|access-date=13 February 2019|website=businessinsider.com|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

=== Microsoft ===

==== 1992–2014 ====
[[File:Satya_Nadella,_CEO_of_Microsoft,_with_former_CEOs_Bill_Gates,_and_Steve_Ballmer.jpg|right|thumb|Nadella on his first day as CEO of Microsoft, with former CEOs [[Bill Gates]] (left) and [[Steve Ballmer]] (right)]]
At Microsoft, Nadella has led major projects that included the company's move to [[cloud computing]] and the development of one of the largest cloud infrastructures in the world.<ref>{{cite news|last=Satya|first=Nadella|title=Satya Nadella CEO|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/business-news/microsoft-names-india-born-satya-nadella-as-next-ceo/article1-1180362.aspx|access-date=7 February 2014|newspaper=Hindustan Times|date=4 February 2014|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140207055143/http://www.hindustantimes.com/business-news/microsoft-names-india-born-satya-nadella-as-next-ceo/article1-1180362.aspx|archive-date=7 February 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

Nadella worked as the senior vice-president of research and development (R&D) for the Online Services Division and vice-president of the Microsoft Business Division. Later, he was made the president of Microsoft's $19 billion Server and Tools Business and led a transformation of the company's business and technology culture from [[Client (computing)|client services]] to [[cloud infrastructure]] and [[Cloud services|services]]. He has been credited for helping bring [[Microsoft SQL Server|Microsoft's database]], [[Windows Server]] and [[Microsoft Visual Studio|developer tools]] to its [[Microsoft Azure|Azure]] cloud.<ref name="Time">{{cite magazine |last=McCracken |first=Harry |url=http://techland.time.com/2014/02/04/satya-nadella/ |title=Microsoft's New CEO Satya Nadella: 10 Things to Know |magazine=Time |date=15 December 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140204183506/http://techland.time.com/2014/02/04/satya-nadella/ |archive-date=4 February 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The revenue from Cloud Services grew to $20.3 billion in June 2013 from $16.6 billion when he took over in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Indo-American Satya Nadella in race to be Microsoft's new CEO|url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2014/01/indo-american-satya-nadella-in-race-to-be-microsofts-new-ceo/|agency=Indo-Asian News Service|publisher=Biharprabha News|access-date=30 January 2014|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201122847/http://news.biharprabha.com/2014/01/indo-american-satya-nadella-in-race-to-be-microsofts-new-ceo/|archive-date=1 February 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He received $84.5 million in 2016 pay.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-10-03/microsoft-ceo-nadella-received-84-million-in-2016-pay|title=Microsoft CEO Nadella Received $84.5 Million in 2016 Pay|date=3 October 2016|access-date=5 November 2017|website=Bloomberg.com}}{{dead link|date=August 2019 }} {{cite web|url=https://www.equilar.com/reports/18-2-200-highest-paid-CEO-rankings-2015.html|title=The New York Times Top 200 Highest-Paid CEOs|publisher=equilar.com|access-date=18 August 2019|df=dmy-all|archive-date=11 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210411051314/https://www.equilar.com/reports/18-2-200-highest-paid-CEO-rankings-2015.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>

In 2013, Nadella's base salary was reportedly $669,167. Including stock bonuses, the total compensation stood at around $7.6 million.<ref>{{cite web|author=Kyle Nazario |url=http://www.itpro.co.uk/staffing/21532/satya-nadella-biography-everything-you-need-to-know-about-microsofts-new-ceo |title=Satya Nadella biography: Everything you need to know about Microsoft's new CEO |publisher=IT PRO |date=27 January 2014}}</ref>

Previous positions held by Nadella include:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=1540690&ticker=MSFT |title=Satya Nadella: Executive Profile & Biography |work=Bloomberg BusinessWeek |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301054203/http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=1540690&ticker=MSFT |archive-date=1 March 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
* President of the Server & Tools Division (9 February 2011 – February 2014)
* Senior Vice-president of Research and Development for the Online Services Division (March 2007 – February 2011)<ref>{{cite web|title=Equilar Atlas|url=http://people.equilar.com/bio/satya-nadella-microsoft/salary/711505|access-date=4 February 2014|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228021502/http://people.equilar.com/bio/satya-nadella-microsoft/salary/711505|archive-date=28 February 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
* Vice-president of the Business Division
* Corporate Vice-president of Business Solutions and Search & Advertising Platform Group
* Executive Vice-president of Cloud and Enterprise group<ref name="Official Bio">{{citation|title=Satya Nadella, President, Server & Tools Business|url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/news/exec/nadella|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140209010050/http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/news/exec/nadella/|access-date=2017-06-26|archive-date=2014-02-09}}</ref>

==== As CEO (2014–) ====
On 4 February 2014, Nadella was announced as the new CEO of Microsoft,<ref name="autogenerated2" /><ref>{{Cite web|title=Microsoft Has Found Its New CEO: Satya Nadella|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2014/02/microsoft-has-new-ceo-satya-nadella/357699/|last=Ohlheiser|first=Abby|date=2014-02-04|website=The Atlantic|language=en-US|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref> the third CEO in the company's history, following [[Bill Gates]] and [[Steve Ballmer]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/microsoft-names-satya-nadella-new-ceo/|title=Microsoft names Satya Nadella new CEO|date=4 February 2014|website=CNET|access-date=11 June 2020|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140206090704/http://news.cnet.com/8301-10805_3-57614575-75/microsoft-names-satya-nadella-new-ceo/|archive-date=6 February 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

In October 2014, Nadella attended an event on Women in Computing and courted controversy after he made a statement that women should not ask for a raise and should trust the system.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/oct/10/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-women-dont-ask-for-a-raise|title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella: women, don't ask for a raise|last1=Staff|last2=agencies|date=10 October 2014|access-date=5 November 2017|website=Theguardian.com|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170917030601/https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/oct/10/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-women-dont-ask-for-a-raise|archive-date=17 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Nadella was criticised for the statement and he later apologized on Twitter.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=satyanadella|author=Satya Nadella|number=520311425726566400|date=9 October 2014|title=Was inarticulate re how women should ask for raise. Our industry must close gender pay gap so a raise is not needed because of a bias #GHC14}}</ref> He then sent an email to Microsoft employees admitting he was "Completely wrong."<ref>{{Cite web|title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella on Women Pay Gaffe: "I Answered That Question Completely Wrong."|url=https://www.vox.com/2014/10/9/11631778/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-on-women-gaffe-i-answered-that-question|last=Swisher|first=Kara|date=2014-10-09|website=Vox|language=en|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref>
[[File:Microsoft_Linux.jpg|right|thumb|Nadella leads a live discussion on Microsoft's cloud strategy in 2014 in San Francisco.]]
Nadella's tenure at Microsoft has emphasized working with companies and technologies with which Microsoft also competes, including [[Apple Inc.]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2014/mar/27/business/la-fi-tn-microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-debuts-himself-office-for-ipad-20140327|title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella publicly debuts himself, Office for iPad|last=O'Brien|first=Chris|date=27 March 2014|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160519193810/http://articles.latimes.com/2014/mar/27/business/la-fi-tn-microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-debuts-himself-office-for-ipad-20140327|archive-date=19 May 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> [[Salesforce]],<ref name="Wired">{{cite news|url=https://www.wired.com/2015/01/microsoft-nadella/|title=Satya Nadella's Got a Plan to Make You Care About Microsoft. The First Step? Holograms|last=Hempel|first=Jesse|date=February 2015|magazine=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170925232351/https://www.wired.com/2015/01/microsoft-nadella/|archive-date=25 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> [[IBM]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2014/10/22/ibm_microsoft_cloud_partnership/|title=Big Azure? Microsoft and IBM ink deal on business cloud|last=Clarke|first=Gavin|date=22 October 2014|work=[[The Register]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170929044811/https://www.theregister.co.uk/2014/10/22/ibm_microsoft_cloud_partnership/|archive-date=29 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and [[Dropbox (service)|Dropbox]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-partners-with-dropbox-2014-11|title=Microsoft Partners With Dropbox|last=Bort|first=Julie|date=4 November 2014|work=[[Business Insider]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170929045026/http://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-partners-with-dropbox-2014-11|archive-date=29 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In contrast to previous Microsoft campaigns against the [[Linux]] operating system, Nadella proclaimed that "Microsoft ❤️ Linux",<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/2836412/microsoft-hearts-linux-for-azures-sake.html|title=Microsoft (hearts) Linux, for Azure's sake|last=Jackson|first=Joab|date=20 October 2014|work=[[PC World]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161022070542/http://www.pcworld.com/article/2836412/microsoft-hearts-linux-for-azures-sake.html|archive-date=22 October 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and Microsoft joined the [[Linux Foundation]] as a Platinum member in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Microsoft just got its Linux Foundation platinum card, becomes top level member|url=https://www.theregister.com/2016/11/16/microsoft_joins_linux_foundation_as_platinum_member/|website=www.theregister.com|language=en|access-date=2020-05-31}}</ref>

Under Nadella, Microsoft revised its mission statement to "empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-outlines-new-mission-statement/|title=Microsoft CEO Nadella wants to help the world 'to achieve more'|last=Statt|first=Nick|date=25 June 2015|work=[[CNET]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170929045122/https://www.cnet.com/news/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-outlines-new-mission-statement/|archive-date=29 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He orchestrated a cultural shift at Microsoft by emphasizing empathy, collaboration, and 'growth mindset'.<ref>{{Cite web|last=byNewsroom|date=2018-06-18|title=Satya Nadella: when empathy is good for business|url=https://www.morningfuture.com/en/article/2018/06/18/microsoft-satya-nadella-empathy-business-management/337/|access-date=2020-06-14|website=www.morningfuture.com|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Transforming culture at Microsoft: Satya Nadella sets a new tone|url=https://www.intheblack.com/articles/2018/06/01/satya-nadella-transforming-culture-microsoft|access-date=2020-06-14|website=www.intheblack.com|language=en}}</ref> He has transformed Microsoft's [[corporate culture]] into one that emphasizes continual learning and growth.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/news/2017/02/20/microsofts-satya-nadella-counting-culture-shock-drive-growth/98011388/|title=Microsoft's Satya Nadella is counting on culture shock to drive growth|last=della Cava|first=Marco|date=20 February 2017|work=[[USA Today]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170929045249/https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/news/2017/02/20/microsofts-satya-nadella-counting-culture-shock-drive-growth/98011388/|archive-date=29 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

In 2014, Nadella's first acquisition with Microsoft was of [[Mojang]], a Swedish game company best known for the computer game ''[[Minecraft]]'', for $2.5 billion. He followed that by purchasing [[Xamarin]] for an undisclosed amount.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-acquires-xamarin-2016-2|title=Microsoft acquires Xamarin|last=Weinberger|first=Matt|date=24 February 2016|work=[[Business Insider]]|access-date=20 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170704105700/http://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-acquires-xamarin-2016-2|archive-date=4 July 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He oversaw the purchase of professional network [[LinkedIn]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/14/business/dealbook/microsoft-to-buy-linkedin-for-26-2-billion.html|title=Microsoft Buys LinkedIn for $26.2 Billion, Reasserting Its Muscle|last=Wingfield|first=Nick|date=13 June 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=20 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170914192636/https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/14/business/dealbook/microsoft-to-buy-linkedin-for-26-2-billion.html|archive-date=14 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> in 2016 for $26.2 billion.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Satya Nadella|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/satya-nadella/|website=Forbes|language=en|access-date=2020-05-26}}</ref> On October 26, 2018, [[Microsoft]] acquired [[GitHub]] for US$7.5 billion.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://news.microsoft.com/2018/06/04/microsoft-to-acquire-github-for-7-5-billion/|title=Microsoft to acquire GitHub for $7.5 billion|date=4 June 2018|work=Microsoft News Center|access-date=1 June 2020}}</ref>

Since Nadella became CEO, Microsoft stock had tripled by September 2018, with a 27% annual growth rate.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://money.cnn.com/2015/12/01/investing/microsoft-stock-satya-nadella-cloud/|title=Is Satya Nadella a better Microsoft CEO than Bill Gates?|last=La Monica|first=Paul R.|date=1 December 2015|work=[[CNN]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170809043924/http://money.cnn.com/2015/12/01/investing/microsoft-stock-satya-nadella-cloud/|archive-date=9 August 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://money.cnn.com/2016/10/21/technology/microsoft-all-time-high/index.html|title=Microsoft stock hits a new all-time high. Here's why|last=Fiegerman|first=Seth|date=21 October 2016|work=[[CNN]]|access-date=28 September 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170929045400/http://money.cnn.com/2016/10/21/technology/microsoft-all-time-high/index.html|archive-date=29 September 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

== Awards and recognition ==
In 2018, he was a ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' 100 honoree.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Isaacson |first1=Walter |title=Satya Nadella |url=https://time.com/collection/most-influential-people-2018/5217556/satya-nadella/ |access-date=2 July 2020 |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=19 April 2018}}</ref> 

In 2019, Nadella was named ''[[Financial Times]]'' Person of the Year and ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' magazine Businessperson of the Year.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Waters |first1=Richard |title=FT Person of the Year: Satya Nadella |url=https://www.ft.com/content/0e8c3002-20c7-11ea-92da-f0c92e957a96 |access-date=6 July 2020 |work=[[Financial Times]] |date=December 19, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Lashinsky |first1=Adam |title=Businessperson of the Year 2019 |url=http://fortune.com/businessperson-of-the-year/2019/satya-nadella/ |access-date=2 July 2020 |publisher=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] |date=19 November 2019}}</ref>

In 2020, Nadella was recognized as Global Indian Business Icon at [[CNBC-TV18]]'s India Business Leader Awards in Mumbai.<ref>{{cite news |title=IBLA 2020: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Wins Global Indian Business Icon |url=https://www.news18.com/news/tech/ibla-2020-microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-wins-global-indian-business-icon-2520079.html |access-date=2 July 2020 |publisher=[[News18]] |date=29 February 2020}}</ref>

In 2022, Nadella was awarded [[Padma Bhushan]], the third highest civilian award in India by the [[Government of India]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Padma Bhushan: Microsoft's Satya Nadella, and Google's Sundar Pichai get Padma Bhushan, India's third-highest civilian award - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/gadgets-news/microsofts-satya-nadella-and-googles-sundar-pichai-get-padma-bhushan-indias-third-highest-civilian-award/articleshow/89122582.cms|date=2022-01-25|website=The Times of India}}</ref>

In 1992, Nadella married Anupama, the daughter of his father's [[Indian Administrative Service|IAS]] [[wikt:en:batchmate|batchmate]]. |work= [[The Times of India]] |title= Nadella's other passions: Cricket, running and pastries }}</ref> The couple had three children, a son and two daughters, and live in [[Clyde Hill, web|last=Drusch|first=Andrea|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2014/02/satya-nadella-biography-key-facts-career-background-microsoft-103106.html|title=10 things to know: Satya Nadella|date=2 April Nadella is an avid reader of [[American poetry|American]] and [[Indian poetry]]. He also nurses a passion for [[cricket]], having played on his school team.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/world/all-for-love-when-satya-nadella-surrendered-his-green-card-for-h1-b-visa-4083165.html|title=All for love: When Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella surrendered his Green Card for wife Anu|website=Firstpost.com|date=26 September 2017|access-date=5 November 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171103222307/http://www.firstpost.com/world/all-for-love-when-satya-nadella-surrendered-his-green-card-for-h1-b-visa-4083165.html|archive-date=3 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Nadella and his wife Anupama are part of the ownership group of [[Seattle Sounders FC]], a [[Major League Soccer]] club.<ref>{{cite news |last=Evans |first=Jayda |date=August 13, 2019 |title=Russell Wilson, Ciara, Macklemore, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and more join Sounders ownership |url=https://www.seattletimes.com/sports/sounders/russell-wilson-ciara-macklemore-microsoft-execs-and-more-join-sounders-ownership-group/ |work=The Seattle Times |access-date=September 1, 2019}}</ref>

He announced that the profits from the book would go to Microsoft Philanthropies and through that to [[nonprofit organization]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2016/6/29/12061722/microsoft-ceo-book-satya-nadella-hit-refresh|title=Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is writing a book called Hit Refresh|date=2016-06-29|website=The Verge|access-date=2017-04-24|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170425121704/http://www.theverge.com/2016/6/29/12061722/microsoft-ceo-book-satya-nadella-hit-refresh|archive-date=25 April 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
